intro: Elatostema balansae var. hispidum, commonly known as the hairy elatostema, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy textures. The plant produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Elatostema balansae var. hispidum is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes cultivated as a ground cover in horticultural settings.
